intro: Tanarius heterophyllus, commonly known as the variable-leaf tanarius, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either simple or compound depending on environmental conditions. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
